Description: Papyrus (mounted in 2 frames, and slightly defective on the right side) written with black ink with demotic legal text (6 ll. and 2 short ll.) and Greek docket (2 ll.) on recto and names of 12 witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "The whole of the writing, both recto and verso, is scored through in ink, but the text is legible. Contents. Probably a post-nuptial settlement by Hap-swe(?) son of Necht-Sebek (Nechtsuchos) on his wife Tasuchis daughter of Sebek-em-heb. Date year 21 Phamenoth 28 of Ptolemy Alexander I = BC. 93 Apr. 11 (the Greek docket bears date of the following day)".
Curator's comments: Text: published in Lüddeckens, Demotische Urkunden aus Hawara, Stuttgart, 1998 (as well as a number of other BM papyri). Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Pestman 1961 / Marriage and matrimonial property in ancient Egypt : a contribution to establishing the legal position of the woman (p.37) (cited in note 3 and note 8 as comparison, dated: 90BC)
Pattie & Turner 1974 / The Written Word on Papyrus: An Exhibition Held in the British Museum 30 July - 27 October 1974 (no.7)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (41468) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/41468)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, fragmentary, loss, degraded Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: fair
Acquisition notes: Purchased from M. Nahman. Cf. the additional sheets at the end of Thompson's MS Catalogue, titled "B.M. Nahman Papyri (1923)".
